results.title: Victoria's favourite things
results.brief_description:
Check out what people brought to ACMI for July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’.
Recorded live in ACMI’s Screen Pit, the event was modelled on a 1960’s variety show and includes songs, stories, bad jokes and some really interesting stuff.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 5
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Karen’s hat; Lyn from Port Melbourne has three ‘favourite’ children; David from Endeavour Hills’ favourite things include his family heritage and his novel; and Erica from Melbourne introduces us to Tigger.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 4
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Hamish from Hawthorn talking about his Game Boy; Mike from Montrose and his keyring; Melissa from East Malvern adores her Dogs; The Monroe Family show us ‘Fairy Ted’ and a geometry book; Atlanta from Abbotsford recalls an idyllic spot called ‘Warm Baths’; Nicholas from Doncaster East follows sports - a lot; Seth from both Istanbul and Ivanhoe talks about sailing; and Isobel from Hawthorn shows us her CareBears

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 1
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Norma from Swan Hill talking about a Mallee root; Alex from Melbourne discusses 19th century literature; Adam Elliott is still thrilled by his Oscar; Lewis loves the Spy Kids movies; Alfred of Reservoir tells us that retirement is his favourite thing and a visitor from Hong Kong bursts into song!

results.title: Vibrato
results.creator_credit: Gerald Hagner, Gerald Hagner Productions and Ohio Arts Council
results.brief_description: Using camera movement, multiple images, and synchronised music to transform nature into a statement of beauty, Gerald Hagner’s award winning film presents a stunning impression of the Appalachian mountains. Without narration. Photographed by Gerald Hagner alone in the Appalachian Mountains, Ohio and synchronised music by Art Kempel.

results.title: VFL: skills
results.brief_description: Step-by-step Australian Rules instructions, skills and techniques demonstrated by senior VFL players. A vital tool in mastering all aspects of this modern, national game for all kids. Includes interviews with Dennis Carroll, Tim Watson and Todd Viney. No other credits available.

results.title: Veterans of the road
results.creator_credit: Esso Petroleum and Veteran Car Club of Great Britain
results.brief_description: Tells the lighthearted story of a Veteran Car Club Rally of vintage cars, held at Abingdon, in Berkshire. Of quaint appearance (none of a later vintage than 1916) and still lively performance, they are seen being submitted to tests of speed, braking and steering, to the delight of many onlookers.

results.title: Vert bleu terre = Green blue ground
results.brief_description: A rather amusing and quirky animated claymation film about two worms, one green and the other blue, trying to outsmart each other over an apple.

results.title: Velocity stock footage
results.brief_description: Using 16mm filmed sequences of motion through different urban and natural spaces, this footage will create a sense of vertigo and velocity across different planes of movement; through space as experienced via car or foot; above space as experienced through elevators and mechanical escalation and across space as experienced via train and so forth. Across different passages of time and space “day, night, city, underground, suburban, rural, alleyway and so forth” the material will imaginatively explore the way a viewing experience can defy human motion and create a dizzying, disorienting but at all times wondrous and alluring moving image experience.
